INtc is losing the batter in chips since it cannot supply low powered chips like ARM chips. The single fact that Win RT is going to branching out quickly can cauise a fetal blow to INTC, making intc sacred as hell. MSFt on the other hand is sound, unlike other PC makers. SO, in summary, MSFt should on one hand pushing Win RT systems, and on the other hand buying the shares back like crasy when it is selling at a effective p/e of 5. Dividends cis not as effective as cuttign down the numbers of shares by 10-20%.

Topic.Title: Microsoft may issue $2-3 special dividend ??

Message.Msg: almsot 70 billions of cah in the bank, and this cash is gwoing by some 20-30 billions each year, and MFT does not need much money, and it is not a caital intensive industry, so surely they should look into either or both special dividend and stock buy back. What is the fun of lettign 70 billions sitting somewhere making close to 1%, other than helping the US government financing its debts? I would help the shareholders first and most, and most employees are also shareholders. Based on MSft histry, MSFt has always distributed its pile of cash to shareholders either by special dividened and stock buyback. At this point, when the shares are trading like dirt, it is way smarter to buy the shares for cancelleation. Once shares are trading higher than 33, then back to dividend.

Topic.Title: Windows 8 - one word SUX

Message.Msg: I will not criticize you as a basher even though you are complaining about something as simple as shutting the PC off. No such thing as a dumb question right!!! If you have a touch screen 1. Swipe in from the right side of screen 2. Tap Settings 3 Tap Power 4 Shut Down If you have a non touch screen 1. Pont mouse at the bottom right hand corner of screen 2. Click the wheel icon Settings on the pop up 3 Tap Power 4 Shut Down Machine shuts off. Pretty straight forward.

Topic.Title: Windows 8 - one word SUX

Message.Msg: I created a desk top icon for one click SHUTDOWN using W7 and it works for W8 too. Message.Title: W8 GODMODE
Message.Msg: How to get God Mode in Windows 8? •Right click on your desktop, select new and then Folder •Name the folder as GodMode.{ED7BA470-8E54-465E-825C-99712043E01C} •As soon as you press on enter the folder icon will become identical to the control panel icon with folder name as GodMode •Double click and open it •That’s it, now you have access to your whole operating system from a single folder

Topic.Title: W8 GODMODE

Message.Msg: It looks like the GodMode folder includes a "Computer" shortcut. Well, Windows 7 has a "Computer" shortcut on the right side of the "Start" menu. But Windows 8 doesn't have a "Start" menu. So search Google for how to add a "My Computer" icon to the Windows 8 desktop.

Message.Title: KS
Message.Msg: http://abclocal.go.com/wls/story?section=news/local&id=8913611

Topic.Title: W8 GODMODE

Message.Msg: W8 has a start menu at the bottom left of desktop, right click on it and choose File Explorer, it's the My Computer. If you want a "computer" tile icon in the Metro Start, find Computer on C: drive, right click and choose Pin to Start. I didn't use Goog since I started computing with w3.1 way back when.

Message.Title: The SWEET thing about going over the fiscal cliff
Message.Msg: The jobs that will be lost will primarily be people who voted for Obama. The unemployment benefits that will be lost will primarily be people's who voted for Obama. The tax increases will be on EVERYBODY - so if you voted for Obama and a chunk of your check is missing in January then remember that you wanted more government. Obama keeps talking about paying their "fair share" when most of the people who voted for him either pay nothing or receive tax money instead of paying it. Hopefully more of them will be paying something now. They get the same benefits from the government that everyone else gets - roads, bridges, defense, etc - even more since they receive welfare, etc - yet he talks about how "rich" people and "everyone" needs to pay their fair share. NOBODY's fair share is zero - or sub-zero. Hopefully going over the fiscal cliff will fix that. Let's go. Let's run it over the cliff. Hopefully more people will start to wake up.
